intro: Acetosa trinervia, commonly known as the three-veined sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, oval-shaped leaves with three distinct veins. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and is often found in moist, calcareous soils. Acetosa trinervia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
